t: Jeremiah 26
In*p the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word from the Lord,*s saying,

Thus*p saith the Lord;*s Stand in the court of the Lord's*s house, and speak unto all the cities of Judah, which come to worship in the Lord's*s house, all the words that I command thee to speak unto them; diminish not a word:
If*p so be they will hearken, and turn every man from his evil way, that I may repent me of the evil, which I purpose to do unto them because of the evil of their doings.
And*p thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord;*s If ye will not hearken to me, to walk in my law, which I have set before you,
To*p hearken to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I sent unto you, both rising up early, and sending them, but ye have not hearkened;
Then*p will I make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.
So*p the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Lord.*s

Now*p it came to pass, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the Lord*s had commanded him to speak unto all the people, that the priests and the prophets and all the people took him, saying, Thou shalt surely die.

Why*p hast thou prophesied in the name of the Lord,*s saying, This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate without an inhabitant? And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.*s
When*p the princes of Judah heard these things, then they came up from the king's house unto the house of the Lord,*s and sat down in the entry of the new gate of the Lord's*s house.
Then*p spake the priests and the prophets unto the princes and to all the people, saying, This man is worthy to die; for he hath prophesied against this city, as ye have heard with your ears.
Then*p spake Jeremiah unto all the princes and to all the people, saying, The Lord*s sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that ye have heard.
Therefore*p now amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the Lord*s your God; and the Lord*s will repent him of the evil that he hath pronounced against you.
As*p for me, behold, I am in your hand: do with me as seemeth good and meet unto you.

But*p know ye for certain, that if ye put me to death, ye shall surely bring innocent blood upon yourselves, and upon this city, and upon the inhabitants thereof: for of a truth the Lord*s hath sent me unto you to speak all these words in your ears.
Then*p said the princes and all the people unto the priests and to the prophets; This man is not worthy to die: for he hath spoken to us in the name of the Lord*s our God.
Then*p rose up certain of the elders of the land, and spake to all the assembly of the people, saying,

Micah*p the Morasthite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and spake to all the people of Judah, saying, Thus saith the Lord*s of hosts; Zion shall be plowed like a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.

Did*p Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him at all to death? did he not fear the Lord,*s and besought the Lord,*s and the Lord*s repented him of the evil which he had pronounced against them? Thus might we procure great evil against our souls.

And*p there was also a man that prophesied in the name of the Lord,*s Urijah the son of Shemaiah of Kirjathâ€“jearim, who prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah:

And*p when Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men, and all the princes, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death: but when Urijah heard it, he was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt;
And*p Jehoiakim the king sent men into Egypt, namely, Elnathan the son of Achbor, and certain men with him into Egypt.
And*p they fetched forth Urijah out of Egypt, and brought him unto Jehoiakim the king; who slew him with the sword, and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.
Nevertheless*p the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
